intro: Phyllactis polystachya, commonly known as the African milk bush, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that is toxic and can cause skin irritation. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Phyllactis polystachya is also valued for its ornamental qualities and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
